abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column expresses concern about settlement reached between Securities and Exchange Commission and Citigroup over failed municipal bond strategy that lost investors an estimated $2 billion; notes Citigroup was not required to acknowledge wrongdoing and no one at bank was held accountable; questions how effective regulators can be if they fail to demand any accountability, or even identify employees responsible.
lead_paragraph: The Citi employees whose strategy led to $2 billion in investor losses have not been pursued or even identified.

headline.main: An S.E.C. Settlement With Citigroup That Fails to Name Names

snippet: The Citi employees whose strategy led to $2 billion in investor losses have not been pursued or even identified.
